condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 'By 2020, increased numbers of pastoralist and displaced children participate in quality primary education services

description.narrative: UNICEF partnered with government and humanitarian partners at all levels to enhance access to education services from pre-primary to secondary education for 3,944,807 (1,802,624 from pastoralist communities, 355,692 internally displaced, 204,766 refugee) through community mobilization, provision of education supplies, training and recruitment of teachers and facilitators, construction and rehabilitation of classrooms. After closure of schools due to COVID-19, UNICEF supported 5.2 million primary and secondary school children (46% girls) to access distance learning. Government and coordination systems were strengthened through staff recruitment, formalizing relationships between different stakeholders, evaluations to inform development of guidelines to support effective education service delivery. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Cluster coordination mechanism for education that meets CCC standards for coordination in humanitarian action

actual.value: 2020:Score 3 While measures have been put in place to promote gender responsiveness in the education system, there are still inequities in the system which favour boys at the expense of girls.
